function_call.name: eval_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":["Potential spread of viruses due to aerosolization and sampling","Viral aerosols exhibit higher uv susceptibility at higher rh.","Enveloped viruses like mhv coronavirus are susceptible to inactivation by mechanical stress.","Aerosolization and sampling can lead to survival of infectious viruses, increasing the risk of disease transmission","Differences in survival rates of viruses in different suspension media can impact disease transmission","Uv susceptibility of viral aerosols varies with different viruses and rh levels, affecting the effectiveness of uv-c disinfection","Potential leakage of viral aerosols due to inadequate sealing of chamber parts.","Contamination of the experimental chamber by microorganisms due to inadequate filtration or backflow prevention.","Potential exposure to viral aerosols during chamber maintenance and operation","Handling of infectious viral samples in the laboratory","Exposure to viral aerosols during experimental procedures","Improper disposal of viral samples and contaminated materials.","Handling and cultivation of bacteriophage ms2 and e. coli c3000 may pose a risk of accidental exposure and infection.","Limited data on the effectiveness of uv air disinfection in preventing airborne transmission of viral aerosols such as sars coronavirus.","Uncertain relationship between relative humidity rh and uv inactivation rate of bacterial aerosols.","Unknown uv susceptibility of pathogenic viral aerosols under varying relative humidity rh conditions.","Potential airborne spread of new pathogens such as sars coronavirus and influenza virus.","Inadequate air exchange leading to high indoor air contamination levels.","Humidification of air using water vapor may create an environment conducive to the growth and spread of airborne pathogens.","Use of germicidal emitters or sources may lead to the production of harmful by-products or chemicals.","Inadequate humidity control in the built environment can promote the growth and spread of airborne pathogens.","Inefficient energy consumption in air conditioning operation can lead to poor indoor air quality and ventilation.","Inadequate positioning of uv tubes for germicidal sources resulting in ineffective disinfection of ventilation ducts and flowing air.","Inaccurate calculation of required power input for uv tubes leading to underperformance or excessive energy consumption.","Inadequate consideration of environmental impact in the selection of energy sources for germicidal treatment.","Lack of consideration for optimal performance of the uv-c fluorescent source.","Inadequate design of the uv-c system leading to high operating costs.","Insufficient consideration of indoor air parameters for different seasons.","Contamination of air conditioning ducts with dust and mold due to environmental conditions.","Electrical breakdowns caused by high humidity and condensation affecting fluorescent lamps.","Inefficient operation of uv-c system in the event of air flow stoppage.","Dependence on specific operating conditions for uv-c system efficiency.","Limited efficiency of conventional t8 fluorescent tubes in uv-c range.","Dependence of uv-c system efficiency on air flow resistance and mechanical effects on lamps.","Fluorescent lamp efficiency falling below 70% in uv-c range at low temperatures and airflow.","Shortened life cycle of fluorescent lamps due to excessive switching cycles.","Significant power consumption and economic costs associated with uv-c system.","Long-term operation of uv-c system without proper maintenance and regulation.","Inaccurate regulation of uv-c system power output.","Failure to monitor uv-c system operating hours and power output.","Decreasing efficiency of uv-c system due to lamp degradation, air temperature, dust pollution, and reflective surface degradation.","Decreasing efficiency of uv-c system due to lamp degradation and environmental factors.","Potential exposure to uv-c radiation for maintenance personnel or occupants if not properly shielded or turned off during maintenance.","Inadequate maintenance of uv-c system leading to reduced disinfection effectiveness.","Poorly designed uv-c system leading to uneven radiation distribution and ineffective disinfection.","Pathogens transmitted through the air","Dependence of inactivation rate on pathogen type and environment","Ineffectiveness of uv-c radiation at disinfecting transported air in central air handling units.","Ozone production as a by-product of uv-c radiation.","Health risks from direct exposure to uv-c radiation.","Shutdown of heat recovery and air circulation.","Unrealistic assumptions about the end of the pandemic peak.","Increased heat demand for continuous ventilation.","High international mobility of people posing a difficult-to-predict risk.","Failure to modify internal conditions leading to heat stress in humans and reduced resistance to infection.","Transmission of sars-cov-2 virus from humans to humans through infectious droplets.","Asymptomatic patients with covid-19 releasing infectious droplets.","Sars-cov-2 virus remaining infectious on surfaces and in indoor air.","Shift from work-related commutes to recreational cycling outside the more densely built city center may lead to higher risk of disease transmission in recreational areas.","Intensified recreational activity in urban periphery.","Greater pedestrian activity in green spaces and parks.","Rise in unemployment and flexible work schedules leading to changes in recreational behaviors.","High population density near recreational trail segments.","Increase in cycling activity during lockdown.","Utilization of google earth engine gee cloud computing platform may pose data security and privacy risks if adequate safeguards are not implemented.","Reliance on strava data as a representation of recreational activity may not capture the full spectrum of users, potentially skewing the results.","Anonymized mobility data may compromise individual privacy and data security.","Easing of restrictions leading to increased social gatherings.","Erosion of moral support for compliance over time.","Noncompliance with stay at home and social distancing measures.","Resistance to authority and measures.","Inequality in compliance due to practical limitations.","Potential decline in compliant behavior over time.","Negative emotions increasing compliance with stay-at-home measures.","Large reductions in retail and recreational activities, as well as in the usage of public transit, and visits to workplaces.","People meeting with friends and relatives outside of their direct household.","Close contact with multiple individuals during data collection or analysis may increase the risk of contagious disease transmission.","Conducting in-person surveys or interviews for data collection may pose a risk of exposure to contagious diseases for both data collectors and participants.","Sharing and handling physical documents or materials during the research process may create opportunities for the transmission of contagious diseases.","Participants may have low compliance with covid-19 mitigation measures, increasing the risk of disease spread.","Perceived clarity of covid-19 measures may be low, leading to confusion and potential non-adherence to the guidelines.","Participants may have opportunities to violate covid-19 mitigation measures, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","Potential influence of political orientation on compliance with pandemic measures."]}
